paragraphs.name: e7ea
paragraphs.text: It’s a social rule that says people give back what they receive, it was popularized by Robert Cialdini in his book Influence. Everyone has been in that type of situation.

paragraphs.name: c599
paragraphs.text: No matter what you do, there’s one thing you always want to keep in mind. I learned this from my mentor: Life is business.
It’s a true win-win situation. You get a free article with value. And I improve my thinking, analyzing, and writing skills.
paragraphs.name: a177
1b33
paragraphs.text: Never forget that nothing in life will happen by itself.

paragraphs.name: ef8f
paragraphs.text: Altruism is different. Which is basically giving for the sake of giving. You don’t expect anything in return.

paragraphs.name: cfba
paragraphs.text: You see? When you give more than you take, you will receive more eventually. It’s not about altruism, it’s not about changing the world. It’s about creating a win-win situation.

d26f109e3f1.title: After this amazing reading all I can say is: I’m going to try it. Thank you.

paragraphs.text: Altruism reduces hypertension.
paragraphs.name: 73fa

ea61c1768a41.title: So agree… The more you authentically give, the more trust there is in the connections you build.

paragraphs.text: So agree… The more you authentically give, the more trust there is in the connections you build. People sense when you want to genuinely help solve their problems. When it is offered for free, they will advocate for you and do whatever it takes to tell others about you. Great reminder to give more than you take.
paragraphs.name: a45d

paragraphs.text: This is very true. Generosity is one of the cornerstones of social interactions. Before good were purchased in stores, they were either exchanged or given as gifts. Giving food, clothes away when you had a surplus was a way to ensure someone would help you out if you became in need the following year.
paragraphs.name: 895d

virtuals.subtitle: Giving away and asking helps you progress in life and build a stronger network and community.

content.subtitle: Giving away and asking helps you progress in life and build a stronger network and community.

paragraphs.text: The reason I don’t have a newsletter is that I don’t really like them (except yours Darius) so I don’t offer one. Giving definitely feels better. For me it’s not about making a sale.

paragraphs.text: The More You Give, The More You Get
paragraphs.name: 430a

paragraphs.text: A value my parents instilled in me from my youth was to give as much as you can, without asking for anything in return. I still hold on to this value especially in a world where there are others less fortunate than us.

c711c7b6d6e6.title: Thanks for the article, I enjoyed reading it.

paragraphs.text: Thanks for the article, I enjoyed reading it. While I was reading about the power of giving I couldn’t but remember Adam Grant and his book “Give and Take: A revolutionary approach to success”. There’s also a nice Ted talk he did on this topic where he explains why givers are the ones behind a company’s success. Thank you for reminding me of the importance of being a genuine giver, not a fake one.
